Package chess.model.player

Class Agent

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.player.Player
chess.model.player.Agent
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Minimax1
public non-sealed class Agent extends Player
A concrete subtype of Player that represents a Chess-playing agent that makes move "intelligently" and fully-autonomously.

This class serves as a base class for all agents. Its default implementation na√Øvely selects random (and legal) movements from the set of available ones depending on the current state of the chessboard.

An agent need not be aware of the state of the entire game, which is why only the chessboard is provided. An implication of this being that, in the case of a stochastic agent (i.e. randomness is involved in its decision-making process), it can never tell if the current state they receive is a result of a regular turn or an undo/redo action (initiated by a human player). If an agent needs to maintain any non-volatile state information, they can do so internally.

See Also:
  • Player
  • ChessGame
API Note:
All agents must extend this class and implement the required method getPlayerMove(Chessboard), which serves as a supplier method to ChessGame. Beware that, generally, one can but should not make calls to the default implementation of this method, unless one has a very good reason to do so.

Agents can be annotated with AgentInfo to customize the display name of the agent, see AgentInfo for details.

Subtypes of Agent may implement their own custom methods and maintain their own states that are crucial to their functioning. Note that agents will be held responsible for managing persistence, i.e. serializing and deserializing their custom states, if applicable.

  • Constructor Details

    • Agent

      public Agent(String name, Color color, int score)
      Constructs this agent with a name, color, and an initial score.

      Note: The player's name must not be empty or contains spaces only.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the agent.
      color - The color of the agent.
      score - The initial score of the agent.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
      FormatException - If the stripped name is empty or contains spaces only.
